Author: paperklipp
Text: The summer after I turned sixteen was a pretty busy one for my family; we had a lot of weddings to go to and vacations with old family friends. Basically spending a lot of time travelling to see people we didn’t see often and hadn’t seen in a few years. Without fail, people would bring up how “good”, “beautiful”, “thin” I looked at each event.   Part of me felt satisfied and validated but I also couldn’t help thinking, like... *if only you people knew what I was putting myself through to look this “good”...*  I was almost angry with them for validating my disorder.

Author: CloudySideDown
Text: It is sad and a lot of women do just want to be skinny. I am really working with my therapist on focusing on being fit.
